This was meant for teens to watch, and in that way, it's sort of enjoyable. My daughters made me watch the whole series over Thanksgiving, and this was the best one. Story is okay. Acting is pretty atrocious. Kristen Stewart makes the same face throughout the film, looking like she's going to vomit. The thing I dislike most is the character of Bella. She is so vanilla boring, and her only personality trait is to be clumsy. It's hard to believe all these creatures are so in love with her. It would be so much more interesting if they portrayed her as more of an outcast or something. And she's really dumb. When Edward tells her he's killed people in the past, she just says "I don't care". Nice. 
i didn't like the direction either, some of the disorienting camera shots for no reason, the flashbacks that were unneccasary. 
But, it's an okay movie. But there is no need to watch all the sequels. They suck, except maybe the last one.

guys… Twilight is literally one of the movies of my life. I’ve been watching it since I was little, and from the very first time I saw it, I created a kind of love that just stayed with me. honestly, every "chill" moment I remember from my life somehow includes me watching this movie. it feels like it became part of my story, you know? it marked me in such a special way, like a movie that just hugs you.

the vibe, the rain, the town, the whole atmosphere… everything pulled me in, and even today I feel the same affection when I watch it. it’s a movie that follows me, that gives me that warm nostalgia, that makes me feel like I’m going back in time for a second.

and like… I love the story, I love the romance, but I’ll be honest: the only thing I’d change is that, in my opinion, it would’ve been SO much better if Bella ended up with Jacob. I always felt like they matched more. but even with that, it doesn’t change the fact that Twilight will forever be one of my favorite movies.

Twilight is a moody, awkward, and era-defining supernatural romance that's more effective as a cultural time capsule than a great film.

Highlights
- Faithful Adaptation: The film is an exceptionally faithful adaptation of Stephenie Meyer's novel.
- Central Romance: The romance created a global phenomenon, launching Kristen Stewart and Robert Pattinson into superstardom.
- Indie Aesthetic: Director Catherine Hardwicke brought a unique, indie-film aesthetic to the project.

Criticisms
- Structural Issues: The plot relies heavily on Bella's internal dialogue, which can feel clunky.
- Mixed Reviews: The film received mixed reviews, with some criticizing the performances and pacing.
- Dated Effects: The special effects and stunt work are unconvincing and dated.

Verdict
Twilight is a fascinating cultural artifact that succeeded in creating a cinematic phenomenon, defining a generation of young adult romance despite its technical flaws and critical divisiveness.

I’m not a fan of most book to film flips because the magic is lost if it’s plot isn’t aligned with the story that readers are looking for. 

The movie gets a lot of things right. The sparkling skin, the shock and allure of vampirism as Bella is exposed to Edward and his family. 

A few things just don’t work like Jasper’s angst coming across as constipation. The makeup for vampire milk white skin is odd and distracting. Overall it’s interesting as its own story but it’s definitely not as impactful as the book. I wanted a “Lord of the Rings” type interpretation but this fell short.
